course.subject: IEDA
course.name: Academic and Professional Development I
course.description: A compulsory one-year course for IEDA students. This course aims to provide academic and professional advising to students and to develop their technical and non-technical communication skills. Industrial and academic seminars will be offered. Graded P or F.

reviews.author: randomstudent1
reviews.title: required course for ieda students
reviews.comment_content: 冇乜特別就係叫好多唔同行業嘅成功人士介紹下佢地自己嗰行究竟做緊d咩間公司offer緊d咩,仲有講下final project嘅資料
reviews.comment_teaching: 一般, 呢d堂有邊個唔係掛機
reviews.comment_grading: pass/fail policy, 交完essay冇叫你做過就冇問題
reviews.comment_workload: attendance, 500 word essay(如果attendance過80%),叫你針對一個presenter來講下學到d咩,今個sem phototaking session冇左所以要自己交相

reviews.author: Genisusl
reviews.title: IEDA Required Course 見到冇人寫 幫手寫下咁解
reviews.comment_content:
IEDA Required Course 見到冇人寫 幫手寫下咁解

1. Presentations by Speakers
Practitioners present the status of their industry sectors and the opportunities for Industrial Engineers.

2. Alumni Talks
IEDA alumni share their knowledge and experiences of their school lives and work opportunities with current students.

Advisory Meetings
Students are encouraged to meet with their advisors in either a group or individual basis to share their experiences and thoughts.

3. Student Faculty Meeting
Students provide feedback and opinions on the IEDA courses they are taking.

4. Individual Report
Students are required to write an individual report on what they have learnt in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
純粹係搵IEDA graduate分享career experience (有Mc Kinsey, Goldman Sachs)

因為次次都係出面搵人講，lecture質素可以好參差

基本上掛機就得, 唔使太認真聽, fulfill到attendance requirement 就ok
reviews.comment_grading:
一係pass 一係fail

交咗份500 words essay 唔係亂做嘅話 同埋上齊哂lecture 就會pass
reviews.comment_workload:
通常係朝早上堂, 開着個Zoom又唔使開cam, 食住早餐掛機就ok

一份500 words Reflection Essay

reviews.author: SkuOfSick&Trash
reviews.title: Short Review Summary
reviews.comment_content:
Basically they ask a bunch of alumni back to UST to have career talks and stuffs like that.

Sometimes they offer free lunch and regular meetings to know more about the students. The meal is GOOD.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The speakers are usually extremely successful people who work in big companies or in banks in which you will never be able to reach to that level and feel depressed and stressful after each talk.

The most important is they often have shit talk and waste our time, WHY THE FXXK DO I NEED TO HEAR YOUR TALK IF I HAVE A HIGH GPA OVER 3.0 OR ABOVE???
reviews.comment_grading:
Its fine as long as you can submit a 500-words report by the end of the semester.

They make our life much more easy in UST.
